input_text.Prompt:
Conversation:
Frida: Hello, 332440.
Alexander: Oh hello, Sally. This is Dave Thomson here. Could I speak to Jim please?
Frida: I'm afraid he's not in at the moment Dave. He went out about an hour ago and he's not back yet.
Alexander: Any idea when he might be back?
Frida: Well, he shouldn't be long. He said he was just going to get some paint. But I wouldn't be surprised if he's stopped off at the pub on the way back.
Alexander: OK. well, tell him I've called, will you, and I'll try again later.
Frida: All right. Goodbye, Dave.
Alexander: Thanks then Sally. Goodbye.

Now write a summary of the conversation:
input_text.Response A: Frida answers the phone and takes a message for Jim from Dave.
input_text.Response B: In this conversation, Frida, a receptionist at a paint store, answers a phone call from Alexander, who is looking to speak to Jim, one of his colleagues. However, Jim is not in at the moment and has gone out to get paint. Frida informs Alexander that Jim should not be long, but that he may have stopped off at the pub on the way back. Alexander asks Frida to tell Jim that he has called and that he will try again later.

label_annotations.feedback: Response A is too basic and doesn't capture any nuance or detail e.g. who the person called was - this would help Jim decide on urgency of callback.  Response B is too detailed.
